body: This plot mixed the absolute shit out of me. First I couldn’t keep up with who was related to who, then the gf finds out but is cool with it so win win, but this guy bails and chooses incest. I don’t mind him fucking his sister, but mans had 3 women on his dick but he downgrades for just 1.
a milf mother and understanding gf is asking a dck and you decide to run away....fcking disappointment
Why couldn’t she leave her husband, that’s what I wanted. Never a fan of netori where the love interest stays in the original relationship, especially when it is the brothers baby.
i agree with all of you his mind was all on his sister and not the daughter and mother a real cunt in the end
The plot is meh, but the art is great.

Eh... this was strange. Usually the stories from tsuyatsuya are way more detailed, but this one... the mainstory actually felt kinda stupid and lackluster. So he runs off from a perfect mother-daughter wincest, because what? Because suddenly, out of nowhere, he discovered his love for his sister? No buildup or anything. Usually the stories of this author have several volumes of story buildup. I almost get the feeling his editor just said "Hey you have so many milf stories, just make one with a sister, at least once." and he just made it for the money, between his actual projects
He left because “it’s weird” what he did afterwards wasn’t weird at all
Omg he’s a fking CUNt how can he leave those two omg i never been more disappointed than now pfff kinda pissed that he left them both fk
Dude why not go to that milf?! Xd

I thought in the end the sister will be divorcing her husband and marry her brother, oh well.
How could she know the father is her brother ? Sigh, and choosing to be with her sister instead with that delicious mother-daughter pair, that's a real siscon right there XD
He should do a harem route with the mother-daughter pair instead doing it with his sister.
I'm honestly quite disappointed that nothing else happened between him and the mother-daughter pair. Bloody retard.
Whets the first volume? There's no point in reading volume 2 with not reading volume 1
